cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west into the eastern Gulf, forecast to curve northwest then northeast, cross north-central Florida mid-week, and emerge off the Southeast U.S. coast late week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / north-central Gulf Coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast to Georgia/South Carolina coasts through Day-5
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<5%) of tropical-storm-force gusts; breezy conditions possible late week-end.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands may bring 1–2 inches of rain if the system tracks farther north offshore.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and dangerous rip currents along the Delaware and New Jersey coasts late week-end.
